intro: Adenophyllum appendiculatum, commonly known as the clustered adenophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its small, white to yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a feature typical of the family. Adenophyllum appendiculatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties.
